newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian PM welcomes upcoming Japan rice tender.
newsitem.headline: Australian PM welcomes upcoming Japan rice tender.

text.p: Australian Prime Minister John Howard on Tuesday welcomed Japan's upcoming import tender for 7,000 tonnes of rice, saying it gave Australian rice growers a chance to expand their presence in Japan.
"It's a good step forward and we hope that it is the harbinger of further progress on that front," Howard told reporters at a joint news conference with Japanese Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto.
Earlier this month, the Japanese Food Agency announced it would hold the tender on May 28.
Howard also said he was hopeful Australian apple growers would secure access to the Japanese market in early May after discussions with Hashimoto on the issue.
"On the question of access, we look forward hopefully to a satisfactory conclusion of our desire for access for Australian Fuji apples," he said.
"The Prime Minister informs me that there is one further public hearing in Japan to take place on May 2 and if that is satisfactorily processed then access can be secured."
Australia, a major exporter of farm products, has consistently pressed Japan for greater access to its lucrative domestic market.
